A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
**Free of Spoilers**.
The magic is gone. Long gone..I consider myself a fan of Star Wars\, not a hardcore\, zealot-like "fan" who can tolerate no criticism of anything that has the name Star Wars on it but as someone who realy loved this sci-fi saga and its heroes. After being somewhat dissapointed with TFA but rather satisfied with Rogue One I went to the movies without realy knowing what to expect. But such a dissapointment I certainly did not. 

Someone should tell the Disney people-if they actually care about producing films that classify as art and not as mindless entertainment for the masses meant to be forgotten in a few weeks time-that the art of filmaking is much more than good special effects. 

Showing respect to the material is paramount when delaing with a story that spans for generations-in real life as well as in the fictional setting of SW. Showing respect to the characters\, having them act in a way consistent with their nature\, is essential to any good form of storytelling. Plot holes can be tolerated-unless of course it is only them that consitute what passes as a plot. 

This movie lacks a soul-and for any work of art that is the greatest anathema.

To sum up-DO NOT SEE THIS if you have any respect to what remotely good filmaking is or you loved Star Wars at any point in your life.
